name: Coed y Brenin Enduro
description: Coed y Brenin is the birthplace of purpose-built mountain bike trails in the UK, and this enduro puts you on some of Britain's finest singletrack. The format is classic enduro: pedal between stages on flowing liaison trails, then race against the clock on technical descents. Expect rocky chutes, rooty sections, bermed corners, and natural features that test your handling skills. The ancient forest provides a stunning backdropâ€”towering conifers, rushing rivers, and that unmistakable Welsh woodland atmosphere. Whether you're a seasoned racer or enduro newcomer, Coed y Brenin delivers world-class riding in a legendary location. The venue's world-class trails have hosted national and international mountain biking events, drawing riders from across the UK and Europe to experience some of Wales' finest singletrack.
who_its_for: Intermediate to advanced mountain bikers with enduro or trail centre experience. Good descending skills essential. Full suspension bike recommended.
whats_special: Birthplace of UK purpose-built MTB trails
Multiple timed stages on natural terrain
